txt.en: Hoardale location despoiled!
Corruptor: Befoul the Water
Despoil the third location along the Hoardale River ([placeholder]/1)
The water here is clean and pure. Sully it
Despoil the third location along the Hoardale River ([placeholder]/1)
Despoil the third location along the Hoardale River ([placeholder]/1)

'Our scouts see them at the river-banks of the Hoardale. My scouts see them in the day and in the night. We shall counter their attempts to breed a wholesome thing and poison the water they seek to use.'

He grins an evil grin.

'Take this and disperse it into the water along the banks where I have marked them.'
The water here needs to be befouled
Despoil the fifth location along the Hoardale River ([placeholder]/1)
Despoil the third location along the Hoardale River
Despoil the fourth location along the Hoardale River
The water here is pure, sully it
'Be swift, [placeholder]. We must see that the Free People do not succeed. Let us build the army of these new creatures that the Ettenmoors gifted to us.'
Despoil the fifth location along the Hoardale River

'Excellent work, [placeholder]. I shall see that you are commended for these efforts. If we cannot breach the walls of the enemy fortress to claim what saplings they discovered, then we shall destroy them with their own efforts to grow and cultivate this flora.'
The water here is pure, befoul it
The water here need not be sullied
The water here is pure, befoul it

Cinaid learned from scouts that the Free People are attempting to get clean water from the Hoardale River. He assumes that this is to feed saplings that they discovered. His orders are clear, befoul the river!
The water here is pure, alter it with filth

Cinaid sent you into the Ettenmoors to target locations along the Hoardale where the Free Folk are looking to collect pure water. You are to befoul the water with poison to thwart the Free People's designs.
The water is poisoned and any collected here will surely not assist in the pure growth of anything that it feeds. Return to Cinaid at Gramsfoot and tell him of your success.
The water here need not be befouled
The water here need not be befouled
